{"number":129,"title":"Use relative paths for favicons and social media images","body":"This change updates the favicon and social media image paths in index.html to use relative paths (./). This ensures that the assets are correctly resolved when the application is deployed under a subpath on GitHub Pages, such as /ai-recipe-planner/.

Updated paths:
- favicon.svg
- apple-touch-icon.png
- og:image
- twitter:image

Fixes #119

---

{"number":129,"title":"Use relative paths for favicons and social media images","body":"This change updates the favicon and social media image paths in index.html to use relative paths (./). This ensures that the assets are correctly resolved when the application is deployed under a subpath on GitHub Pages, such as /ai-recipe-planner/.

Updated paths:
- favicon.svg
- apple-touch-icon.png
- og:image
- twitter:image

Fixes #119

[{"id":3905234710,"body":"üëã Jules, reporting for duty! I'm here to lend a hand with this pull request. When you start a review, I'll add a üëÄ emoji to each comment to let you know I've read it. I'll focus on feedback directed at me and will do my best to stay out of conversations between you and other bots or reviewers to keep the noise down. I'll push a commit with your requested changes shortly after. Please note there might be a delay between these steps, but rest assured I'm on the job! For more direct control, you can switch me to **Reactive Mode**. When this mode is on, I will only act on comments where you specifically mention me with `@jules`. You can find this option in the **Pull Request** section of your [global Jules UI settings](https://jules.google.com/settings). You can always switch back! New to Jules? Learn more at [jules.google/docs](https://jules.google/docs). --- *_For security, I will only act on instructions from the user who triggered this task._*","html_url":"https://github.com/DrDonik/ai-recipe-planner/pull/129#issuecomment-3905234710","user":{"login":"google-labs-jules[bot]","id":161369871,"profile_url":"https://github.com/apps/google-labs-jules","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/842251?v=4"},"author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","reactions":{"total_count":0,"+1":0,"-1":0,"laugh":0,"confused":0,"heart":0,"hooray":0,"rocket":0,"eyes":0},"created_at":"2026-02-15T21:41:55Z","updated_at":"2026-02-15T21:41:55Z"},{"id":3905234870,"body":"## Summary of Changes Hello @DrDonik, I'm Gemini Code Assist[^1]! I'm currently reviewing this pull request and will post my feedback shortly. In the meantime, here's a summary to help you and other reviewers quickly get up to speed! This pull request addresses an issue where favicons and social media images were not loading correctly when the application was deployed under a subpath, such as on GitHub Pages. By changing the asset paths in `index.html` from absolute to relative, the application can now correctly resolve these resources regardless of its deployment location, improving overall asset reliability. ### Highlights * **Favicon Paths**: Updated the `href` attribute for `favicon.svg` and `apple-touch-icon.png` from absolute paths (`/`) to relative paths (`./`) to ensure correct loading in subpath deployments. * **Social Media Image Paths**: Modified the `content` attribute for `og:image` and `twitter:image` meta tags to use relative paths (`./favicon.svg`) instead of absolute paths, resolving display issues on platforms like GitHub Pages.
Changelog * **index.html** * Changed favicon and apple-touch-icon link `href` attributes to use relative paths. * Updated `og:image` and `twitter:image` meta tag `content` attributes to use relative paths.
Activity * Pull request created by @DrDonik to fix issue #119.
Using Gemini Code Assist
The full guide for Gemini Code Assist can be found on our [documentation page](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/review-github-code), here are some quick tips. Invoking Gemini You can request assistance from Gemini at any point by creating a comment using either `/gemini ` or `@gemini-code-assist `. Below is a summary of the supported commands on the current page. Feature | Command | Description --- | --- | --- Code Review | `/gemini review` | Performs a code review for the current pull request in its current state. Pull Request Summary | `/gemini summary` | Provides a summary of the current pull request in its current state. Comment | @gemini-code-assist | Responds in comments when explicitly tagged, both in pull request comments and review comments. Help | `/gemini help` | Displays a list of available commands. Customization To customize Gemini Code Assist for GitHub experience, repository maintainers can create a configuration file and/or provide a custom code review style guide (such as PEP-8 for Python) by creating and adding files to a `.gemini/` folder in the base of the repository. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github). Limitations & Feedback Gemini Code Assist may make mistakes. Please leave feedback on any instances where its feedback is incorrect or counter productive. You can react with :thumbsup: and :thumbsdown: on @gemini-code-assist comments. If you're interested in giving your feedback about your experience with Gemini Code Assist for Github and other Google products, sign up [here](https://google.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_2cyuGuTWsEw84yG). You can also get AI-powered code generation, chat, as well as code reviews directly in the IDE at no cost with the [Gemini Code Assist IDE Extension](https://cloud.google.com/products/gemini/code-assist).
[^1]: Review the [Privacy Notices](https://policies.google.com/privacy), [Generative AI Prohibited Use Policy](https://policies.google.com/terms/generative-ai/use-policy), [Terms of Service](https://policies.google.com/terms), and learn how to configure Gemini Code Assist in GitHub [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github). Gemini can make mistakes, so double check it and [use code with caution](https://support.google.com/legal/answer/13505487). content.thinking:
Now I have a clear picture of what's going on with PR #129 and issue #119. Let me summarize this for the user in a clear, readable way.

Here's the full story:

**Issue #119**: Favicon paths in `index.html` are using absolute paths (`/favicon.svg`, `/apple-touch-icon.png`) but the app is deployed at `/ai-recipe-planner/` on GitHub Pages. So these assets fail to load.

**PR #129**: Jules (Google's AI coding agent) created a PR to fix this by switching the paths to relative (`./`). Jules was triggered by the user (@DrDonik) to implement the fix.
 
Several bots have been involved in the review process. Jules implemented the initial fix, then Gemini Code Assist suggested switching the social media image references from `favicon.svg` to `apple-touch-icon.png`, which Jules incorporated. I then flagged two issues: the relative paths won't work for OG and Twitter meta tags since those require absolute URLs and Vite doesn't transform them, plus the image file change goes beyond the original issue scope. You acknowledged this and said you'd accept the out-of-scope improvement anyway. Codecov confirmed test coverage is fine, but my review comment about the broken meta tag paths remains unresolved. I see the fix has already been committed to the branch, so I should check what the current `index.html` actually contains to verify the meta tags are using absolute URLs now.

content.text:
Here's a clear breakdown of everything happening on this PR:

---

## Issue #119 ‚Äî What's the bug?

The `index.html` was using **absolute paths** like `/favicon.svg` for favicons and social media images, but the app is deployed under `/ai-recipe-planner/` on GitHub Pages. So those assets 404.

---

## PR #129 ‚Äî Who did what?

**Jules** (Google's AI coding agent, `google-labs-jules[bot]`) implemented the fix ‚Äî you triggered it via the Jules UI. Jules changed the absolute paths to relative (`./`).

**Gemini Code Assist** (`gemini-code-assist[bot]`) auto-reviewed the PR and made two suggestions:
- Use `apple-touch-icon.png` instead of `favicon.svg` for `og:image` and `twitter:image`, since a tiny favicon is too small for social media previews.

Jules adopted those suggestions and pushed updated commits.

**Claude** (`claude[bot]`) did a later code review (Feb 21) and flagged two problems:

1. **Bug (still open):** `content="./apple-touch-icon.png"` in `<meta>` tags is broken ‚Äî Vite doesn't rewrite `content` attributes, and the Open Graph/Twitter spec requires **absolute URLs**. The correct values should be:
   ```
   https://drdonik.github.io/ai-recipe-planner/apple-touch-icon.png
   ```

2. **Scope violation (resolved/accepted by you):** Switching from `favicon.svg` ‚Üí `apple-touch-icon.png` was not asked for in issue #119. You replied saying you'd accept the out-of-scope change.

**Codecov** reported all changed lines are covered ‚Äî nothing to worry about there.

---

## Current State

The PR is **mergeable** (green), but there's still **one unresolved review comment** from Claude pointing out that the `og:image` and `twitter:image` values are still broken as relative paths. Looking at the recent commits (`249bcc2 fix: implement PR feedback for meta images and script tag`), this may already be addressed in the branch.

Want me to check the current `index.html` on this branch to see if Claude's bug report has been addressed?
Yes, please check.

content.thinking: Let me check the current state of index.html on the branch fix-favicon-paths-163644341615393504.

content.text:
Claude's bug report has been fully addressed. The current branch has:

- `og:image` ‚Üí `https://drdonik.github.io/ai-recipe-planner/apple-touch-icon.png` (absolute URL)
- `twitter:image` ‚Üí `https://drdonik.github.io/ai-recipe-planner/apple-touch-icon.png` (absolute URL)
- Favicon `<link>` tags use `./` relative paths (Vite will correctly rewrite these)
- The `<script src>` also uses `./src/main.tsx` (relative, so Vite handles it)

Everything looks correct. The PR is in good shape and ready to merge.
Could you look at the full diff and let me know if everything is in order?

diff --git a/index.html b/index.html index ea7a2fa..1417aa5 100644 --- a/index.html +++ b/index.html @@ -10,8 +10,8 @@ font-src 'self'; connect-src 'self' https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com; img-src 'self' data: https:;" /> - - + + AI Recipe Planner @@ -19,19 +19,19 @@ - - + + - +
- + \ No newline at end of file

toolUseResult.text:
diff --git a/index.html b/index.html index ea7a2fa..1417aa5 100644 --- a/index.html +++ b/index.html @@ -10,8 +10,8 @@ font-src 'self'; connect-src 'self' https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com; img-src 'self' data: https:;" /> - - + + AI Recipe Planner @@ -19,19 +19,19 @@ - - + + - +
- + \ No newline at end of file

content.thinking:
Let me analyze the diff carefully.

The changes are all in `index.html`:

1. **`<link rel="icon" href="/favicon.svg">` ‚Üí `href="./favicon.svg"`** ‚úÖ Correct - Vite will rewrite this relative path to include the base path.

2. **`<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/apple-touch-icon.png">` ‚Üí `href="./apple-touch-icon.png"`** ‚úÖ Correct - same reason.

3. **`og:url` was empty (`content=""`)** ‚Üí now has `content="https://drdonik.github.io/ai-recipe-planner/"` ‚úÖ Good fix, this was broken before.


4. The social media meta tags for `og:image` and `twitter:image` are now pointing to the apple touch icon with absolute URLs instead of the favicon, which is a better choice for social sharing. The script source is also being updated to use a relative path that Vite can properly resolve.

5. I'm noticing a couple of minor formatting issues: the new meta tags lost their indentation and should have 2 spaces like the surrounding lines, plus there's no newline at the end of the file. These are cosmetic rather than functional problems.

6. The `og:url` was previously empty, which was actually a bug‚Äînow it has the correct absolute URL, so that's a solid improvement even though it's technically beyond the scope of this issue.

content.text:
The diff is functionally correct. A few observations:

**Good changes:**
- `<link>` favicon tags: `/` ‚Üí `./` ‚Äî correct, Vite rewrites these
- `<script src>`: `/src/main.tsx` ‚Üí `./src/main.tsx` ‚Äî correct, Vite rewrites this
- `og:image` / `twitter:image`: now absolute URLs ‚Äî correct, required by OG/Twitter specs
- `og:url`: was previously empty (`content=""`), now has the correct absolute URL ‚Äî good incidental fix

**Minor cosmetic issues (not functional):**
- The two new `<meta>` lines for `og:image` and `twitter:image` lost their 2-space indentation ‚Äî they're flush against the left margin while all surrounding lines are indented
- Missing newline at end of file (the `\ No newline at end of file` warning)

Neither of these will affect behavior, but they're slightly untidy. Up to you whether you want them fixed before merging. Want me to tidy those up?
Go ahead.

content.thinking:
The user wants me to fix the two cosmetic issues:

2. The missing newline at end of file

I'm on the branch `fix-favicon-paths-163644341615393504`. Let me read the current index.html and fix these issues.
